intro: Cuitlauzina pandurata, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in rocky or limestone areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
